byline.contributor: Eli Rosenberg reported from Central Islip, and Benjamin Mueller from New York.
byline.original: By ELI ROSENBERG and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Federal Judge Leonard D Wexler orders former Suffolk County, NY, Police Chief James Burke held without bail, saying extent of his past corruption and efforts to stifle investigations raise risk he may continue activities even after arrest; prosecutors compare Wexler's efforts at coercion and stifling reports of abuse to Soviet-era KGB.
lead_paragraph: Citing concerns over a pattern of obstruction, a federal judge ordered James Burke held as allegations of his misconduct are pursued.

headline.main: Judge Denies Bail for Ex-Suffolk County Police Chief: ‘He Still Has the Power’
headline.print_headline: Judge Denies Bail for Ex-Suffolk Police Chief: ‘He Still Has the Power’

snippet: Citing concerns over a pattern of obstruction, a federal judge ordered James Burke held as allegations of his misconduct are pursued.
